eventTimestamp.description: ISO 8601. Reflects the current UTC time.

traceId.description: A unique identifier to be able to trace this message. Also used to detect duplicate messages received.

operatingDayDate.description: The scheduled date of the journey.

journeyNumber.description: The journey number. May describe a part of the vehicleJourneyRef that should be interpreted in scope of a certain line or an operator.

journeyPatternRef.description: A unique identifier for the original journey pattern. E.g. 16-digit ID.

timedJourneyPatternRef.description: Optional. Identifier for a journey pattern with a unique timing pattern. Format to be agreed.

transportAuthority.description: Information about the transport authority that provides the journey.

contractor.description: Optional. Information about the operator that is contracted to operate the journey.

plannedStartDateTime.description: The date and time when the journey is planned to start. ISO 8601, UTC.

plannedEndDateTime.description: The date and time when the journey is planned to end. ISO 8601, UTC.

origin.description: The place where the journey comes from.

line.description: Optional. Only provided for service journeys. Information about the journey’s line.

directionOfLine.description: Optional. Only provided for service journeys. Information about the journey’s direction on the line.

calls.description: Points that shall be called at during the journey. At least two items.

ref.description: Optional. Only provided for service journeys. Information about the journey’s line.

designation.description: The public line number displayed to passengers. Note: this value can be alphanumeric!

code.description: A value that is unique per direction.

shortName.description: Optional. Short name of the origin.

productName.description: Optional. Name of public transport product.

symbolName.description: Optional. Controls any symbols in display.

displayKeys.description: Optional. Contains device specific information such as sign codes etcetera. See 5.6.20. A numeric sign code representing the combined destination display information could thus be provided in a contained key with appropriate parameterData. E.g. “Destination=659” It is possible to provide information for multiple display devices in parallel if there is a mixed fleet with different hardware by providing multiple Keys in parallel. E.g. one Key with "deviceName": "SIGN_X" and another Key with "deviceName": "SIGN_Y".

shortName.description: Optional. Short name of the destination.
Optional. Short name of the destination.

secondaryDestinationType.description: Optional. The meaning of the secondary destination.

sequenceNumber.description: The order of the call on the vehicle journey. Increasing. Note that the numbering can start with a higher number than 1 and that there might be holes in the sequence numbering as not expected calls are excluded.

journeyPatternPoint.description: The point to call. (May be updated in real time).

stopArea.description: Optional. The stop area of the call. (May be updated in real time).

stopPoint.description: Optional. The stop point of the call. (May be updated in real time).

isCancelledCall.description: Optional. Only provided if true. Boolean that indicates if this is call is cancelled without being replaced. In this case the call to the above-mentioned stop should be presented as cancelled.

replacedJourneyPatternPoint.description: Optional. Only provided if the original Journey Pattern Point is replaced. Describes the replaced point. Represents the original (planned) information.

replacedStopArea.description: Optional. Only present if the original StopArea is replaced. Describes the replaced stop area. Represents the original (planned) information.

replacedStopPoint.description: Optional. Only present if the original StopPoint is replaced. Describes the replaced stop point. Represents the original (planned) information.

fetcherConnections.description: Optional. Planned fetcher (distributor) protected connections. A list of vehicle journeys that must wait for passengers from this vehicle journey at this stop even if it is delayed. Relevant for passenger information.

feederConnections.description: Optional. Planned feeder protected connections. A list of vehicle journeys that this vehicle journey should await passengers from at this stop even if the feeding journeys are delayed. Relevant for driver information.

isTimingPoint.description: Boolean that indicates if this is a point where the driver should respect the departure time.

location.description: Optional. The position of the point in Latitude/Longitude.

distanceFromPrevious.description: Optional. Meters from previous point. The first call has the value zero.

tariffZones.description: Optional. Tariff Zones valid for this point.

designation.description: Optional. Track, gate, stop etc. as shown to the public. This is for local orientation within a stop area, bus terminal or station.

localNumber.description: The display order of stops within a stop area.

length.description: Optional. The stops capacity in meters.

stopPointKeys.description: Optional. Array with point specific information.

latestDateTime.description: The latest arrival time expected according to original plan. Arrival after this time is LATE. ISO 8601, UTC.

arrivalType.description: Usage of the arrival according to original plan. NoStop and StopNoBoarding means that the departure should NOT be presented public.

earliestDateTime.description: The earliest permitted departure time according to original plan. Departure before this time is EARLY. ISO 8601, UTC.

departureType.description: Usage of the departure according to original plan. NoStop and StopNoAlighting means that the arrival should NOT be presented public.

number.description: The number of the object that the organisation info refers to. Transport Authority number or Contractor Number.

deviceName.description: Name of devices for which this key applies.

parameterData.description: The data formatted in an agreed (that could be customer specific) format for the specified DeviceName and TypeCode.

number.description: The number of the tariff zone unique within the transport authority.

connectionRef.description: Identifier used for matching with real-time data in later stage. Is unique in scope of current vehicle journey and call sequenceNumber. Typically has the value of the connecting journeys directionOfLineRef.

transportModeCode.description: The transport mode. Possible values in examples.

lineAuthorityCode.description: Short abbreviation for the organisation providing the connecting journey. Possible values in examples.

lineDesignation.description: The public line number displayed to passengers for the connecting journey. Observe that this value can be alphanumeric!

directionName.description: Optional. Name of direction for connecting journey.

stopAreaName.description: Optional. Name of stop for the connecting journey. Only included if different stop than the stop this vehicle stops at.

stopPointDesignation.description: Optional. Platform/track/gate number or letter as shown to the public for the stop of the connecting journey. This is for local orientation within a stop area, bus terminal or station.

minChangeDurationSeconds.description: The minimum number of seconds needed to transfer (walk) between the involved vehicles. May need to be multiplied by some factors depending on different passenger abilities.

maxWaitingUntilTime.description: Optional. The date and time when the connection guarantee ends. The fetcher vehicle may leave at this time even if feeder vehicle has not yet arrived. ISO 8601, UTC.
